properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 10 at 10:34AM CST until February 11 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Norman OK
properties.description:
...Freezing rain expected this afternoon and evening...

.An upper level storm system will result in increasing
precipitation chances this afternoon and evening across portions
of western north Texas and western Oklahoma. Temperatures across
this area vary from near below freezing along I-40 to the upper
30s across southwestern Oklahoma. However, as precipitation
develops most temperatures will begin to drop below freezing and
the rain will begin to freeze on contact, especially on elevated
surfaces.

* WHAT...Mainly freezing rain, with some light sleet and snow also
possible. Total ice accumulations of around one tenth of an
inch.

* WHERE...Portions of northwest, southwest and western Oklahoma
and northern Texas.

* WHEN...Until midnight CST tonight.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions, especially on
bridges and overpasses. The hazardous conditions could impact
the evening commute.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

In Oklahoma, call 8 4 4 4 6 5 4 9 9 7 for road information. In
Texas, call 8 0 0 4 5 2 9 2 9 2 for road information.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT
